snippet: Does anyone doubt that there is a quid pro quo when doctors earning millions of Medicare dollars write big checks to senators and political parties?
abstract: Editorial on data showing that doctors who are top recipients of Medicare reimbursement dollars have donated heavily to 'super PACs' in the hopes of getting Medicare investigators off their backs; maintains it is undeniable there is a quid pro quo in the donations, and that it underscores the need for campaign finance reform.
lead_paragraph: Does anyone doubt that there is a quid pro quo when doctors earning millions of Medicare dollars write big checks to senators and political parties?
